intro: Stachystemon brachyphyllus, commonly known as the short-leaf stachystemon, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne in dense inflorescences. Stachystemon brachyphyllus is often found in shaded, moist environments within forest understories.
